sentence.Network_en: It is nearly always women who are the primary care givers.
sentence.Network_cn: 从事初级保健护理工作的几乎都是女性。

sentence.Network_en: She denied the murder of four children who were in her care.
sentence.Network_cn: 她否认杀害了她所照管的4个孩子。

sentence.Network_en: She had met both sons and did not care for either.
sentence.Network_cn: 两个儿子她都见了，一个都不喜欢。

sentences.sentence: "all ye that labor and are heavy-laden"-Matt.11:28

auth_sentence.content: Still, I think our leaders care about us.
auth_sentence.res_content: Still, I think our leaders care about us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Still, I think our leaders care about us.

auth_sentence.content: Funding for social care remains the most divisive issue.
auth_sentence.res_content: Funding for social care remains the most divisive issue.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Funding for social care remains the most divisive issue.

auth_sentence.content: Most of the time the NHS provides good care.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most of the time the NHS provides good care.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most of the time the NHS provides good care.
